meanings.definition: (Spanish/Portuguese) Third-person singular present indicative of separar. (English: separates)

examples.sentence: Ella separa la ropa blanca de la de color. (Spanish)
examples.translation: She separates the white clothes from the colored ones.

etymology.value: From the Spanish/Portuguese verb 'separar', which comes from Latin 'separare'.

usage_notes.explanation: 'Separa' is not an English word. It is the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'separar' in Spanish and Portuguese. It means 'he/she/it separates'.
